column1: I only speak a little Japanese.
column2: 私 は 少しだけ 日本ーご が 話せます。
column3: Watashi wa sukoshi dake Nihongo ga hanasemasu.

column4: This is used when meeting someone for the first time.
For example 'I am John' would be 'ジョンです。' (Jon desu.)

column3: X wa doko ni arimasu ka?

column2: すみません、わかりません。

column4: Upon entering a store, restaurant, etc. you might hear the staff say this to you.
The waiter will show you to your table and say this.

column1: Do you have an English menu?
column2: 英語のメニューがありますか?
column3: Eigo no menyū ga arimasu ka?

column1: Have you decided on what you want to order?
column2: ご注文はお決まりですか?
column3: Go chūmon wa okimari desu ka?

column1: Can I have a little bit more time?
column2: もう少し時間を頂けますか?
column3: Mō sukoshi jikan o itadakemasu ka?

column4: To get the attention of a waiter, raise your hand and say this. Many restaurants also have call buttons for each table.

column1: Can I have one of X, please?
Can I have two of X, please?
Can I have the bill, please?
column2: お勘定をお願いします.
column4: If the bill was placed on your table earlier, as in many small restaurants, take it to the cashier to pay.
After paying the bill, you might say this to the staff.
